title: Excellent Gift for Classroom Valentine Exchange
text: These were packaged nicely. The cards and clear plastic bags that came with the slime, made it easy to transport and pass out to classmates. The slime was a good size and good quality.

title: Great slime kit!
text: Perfect slime making kit. My 9 year old loved it!

title: Just what I wanted
text: The fit is typical. My husband usually wears a Large and this fit perfectly. The positioning of the cape is little off, but it worked great for a SuperHero 5k.

title: Great gift
text: I purchased this for my 2 year old daughter. She loves playing "Doc McStuffins." My 5 year old enjoys playing with her as well. The medical bag holds up well and all of the medical instruments are fun for the kids.

title: Great fun
text: Bought this for my niece who had asked for a pranking kit to fool her mom.  I got to listen in on some of the hijinx.  Lots of fun.

title: Beautiful but Horrible
text: First impression of these were great. They are beautiful dice, well made. I ordered 4 sets of these dice, different colors. These are best kept in a cabinet and not rolled; here is where it gets dicey, pun intended. After playing several D&D games, we very QUICKLY discovered how poorly they roll. So much so, that we had to take notes and get stats on probability. Referencing the d20 here, all 4 sets consistently rolled under 8, 87% of the time. Our parties were wiping quickly and early on, and the entire experience sucked because nobody could successfully perform a d20 roll for anything. We rolled these hundreds and hundreds of times and collected the data. We could not ignore the results. We are not sure if this batch was unbalanced, or something went wrong, but they are completely unusable. We'll either toss them in the trash or shelve them indefinitely. It's really too bad, they are beautiful dice.

title: Great Starter Drone BUT
text: We love this thing, however the issue is with having to sync the drone with the remote every single time you go to use it. Sometimes it syncs, other times it refuses to. This issue causes us only to be able to use it maybe half the time. Very disappointing. Otherwise, if we could use it more, it would be the perfect starter drone for anyone. It's stable, does not break easy and easy to control indoors and out.

title: Great Tool for Homeschool
text: Enjoy these blocks and how they snap together like Legos. They help me to make concepts easier to understand for our 9 year old daughter.

title: Gets the Job Done - Just Ok
text: These are ok, I like that they came with a container to hold them in. It is hard to believe that a simple set of lightweight plastic pieces could cost nearly $30.00, almost like Lego it is over-priced. If the blocks were heavier plastic, maybe, but they do seem pretty lightweight. I am afraid these will crack if they fall on a hardwood or solid floor. The actual cubes (Not the ones pieces), I expected that the depth of the lines would be more pronounced, they are not that deep. Overall, probably not the best for the money, but it does get the job done.

title: Great!
text: Really good quality flash cards.

title: Good
text: Good and fun set for your kids.

title: Fun and Good
text: Great little selection of cars. May not be up to cars made pre 1990 but good nonetheless.

title: Good Stuff
text: Love original Crayons and these are awesome. Kids love the large assortment and keeps them entertained for hours on end.

title: Nice Little Set
text: My 8 year old daughter loved this for about 3 hours and then it got lost in the bottomless toy drawer. I grew up with Spirograph in the 1970's and this is very much like those sets except it does not have all the tools of the original. When this arrived and I took it out of the packaging, I was very surprised how small it is. Kids attention spans have decreased over the years, something like this may not be for everyone in this day and age. I love it though, I probably got it because I felt nostalgic.

title: Be Careful - Not Durable At All
text: This lasted about 3 days at most and then the legs and head completely stopped working. Clever toy otherwise and would be great if the mechanical parts continued to work. Maybe if you make a wheelchair for the paralyzed bird that kept it moving, could rate it higher.

title: Love It!
text: HAHAHA great gag gift or something to throw off unsuspecting friends/family. Highly recommend!

title: Great Dice
text: Had a lot of dice since the 1970's and these have been my luckiest lol. Not that they will save you from a gelatinous cube when your party is in a forest but hey, nice dice thanks!

title: Fun Product, Lacks Documentation
text: Love this rock tumbler. It's not as noisy as I thought it would be but after a while, our ears started hearing it more and more. The tumbler itself is made of thicker rubber, so it helps to muffle the sound... a bit. Our only complaint is that the item comes with limited instructions. For example, the box contains a small clear plastic wrapper with some odds and ends in it, we have no idea what they are used for and no documentation for any of the pieces is included.

title: Not what we expected
text: These were much smaller than expected. So much so that they are not playable or practical as a toy. I remember getting something similar as gifts in the 70's and 80's but these are nothing like those. The size of these are just too small to be functional. Find the originals and you will be glad you did.

title: Fun Toy!
text: This works perfectly after some practice. Have to find that sweet spot on your hand to make the perfect toot! Once I got the hang of it, I could move it to different areas of my palm to make the type of toot I wanted! Durable and well made, this has been passed around my entire family and has not worn out lol! Highly recommend!

title: Good quality!
text: Big! Lots of space and separate smaller compartments on top for little items such as shoes and accessories.

title: Cute but simple
text:
This is a cute set! My 3 yo loves Gabby's Dollhouse so I figured these would be great for an upcoming road-trip. First, they are difficult to open. It took my husband each time to actually get the “room” to open. Not ideal for tiny hands.

There are small parts, so so be mindful of that. There are little accessories for each of the rooms that come in little kitty shaped “boxes”. These boxes are familiar because the large Gabby's dollhouse also has these. When you buy sets of them, you also have a QR code that gives you bonuses in the app.

The little accessory boxes in this set also have QR codes that take you to the app page for the Gabby's Dollhouse app. Unfortunately none of them do anything for the app. Very disappointing for a kiddo who already knows that mechanic and it leads to nothing.

The sets themselves are also simple, little sticker backgrounds for each keychain “room”. The figures are nice but Mercat will not stand up for anything, she falls over constantly.

title: Beautiful and true to online pictures
text: These look exactly like they do in the product listing. They are beautiful and the gradient is perfect for my eladrin character. They are nicely balanced and feel great to roll. They sound great on and off my tray. The finish is pretty good, though some of the inking in the numbers is patchy so I will likely go over it again to get more even color in the numbers.

title: Great variety of toys and tools for the price
text:
I am a play therapist and I am always searching for toy sets that meet my in office needs for durability, variety, and compact. This is a great set for doctor and dentist imaginative play.

It has a large variety of toys and most of them seem well made. They are plastic, which is less durable than a wood set, but they are also easier to clean/sanitize. It can be hard for kids to open so I leave it open after cleaning for the next child.

It is pink and therefore gendered, this might not be an issue for a lot of people but I do wish it was more neutrally colored as some kids refuse to play with gender-colored toys (ex. A lot of Boys are less likely touch this because it's pink).

Some of the items feel a little flimsy but they are holding up well initially. The items that have a function work, lighting up, which is a nice way to make play more immersive for kids.

Overall, it is a great gift at this price point for a child who likes pink things and doctor/dentist play.

title: Fantastic play set for therapy
text:
As a play therapist, I immediately jumped on this. Melissa and Doug makes great toys and play materials and this set is no different. The pieces I was most concerned about are the foam shield and the sword but so far they have held up well to heavy use with my clients on a daily basis for nearly a year.

These are easy to clean and offer a variety of options for play (knight, king, queen, etc). I also have a crown and scepter that are frequently used with this set. The hood does not get much use as I worry about lice working with many kids but the rest of the set is easy to use and maintain.

title: Disappointing quality
text:
My daughter, like many toddlers, loved the Paw Patrol movie. So I thought she would love this set to play dress up with. I am a play therapist and we are big on dress up in our home.

This set has abysmal quality. The ears are floppy and poorly constructed, being too heavy in the front, they easily fall off. The accessories are worse than dollar store quality. They are put together crooked and have some sharp pieces where the plastic was pressed together. Very disappointed in this set. We will go back to using a generic (and cheaper!) police accessory dress up set and pretending.

title: Big hit
text:
My daughter is almost 3 and has become a huge fan of pj mask. These are very nicely made. They were hard for her to have sit and articulate initially but after playing with them for while they are easy for her to use and play with. These are her favorite toys right now and they frequently make cameos with the paw patrol. This even includes the staff!
Great set for the hero's!

title: Cute but stopped working after an hour
text:
[[VIDEOID:1a4975ebfe9d23da06d6ce85c8b8add1]] This is a cute little sun dancer. My daughter loves all things Halloween and skeletons so I figured she'd love this. It arrived in an envelope with just a thin plastic cover over it. No brand or label or directions, etc. It started “dancing” right out of the package and I put it in a sunny window (FL). It worked great for the first few hours then it stopped completely and it hasn't worked since.

It was very cute while it was working and I don't know if we got a dud or not but the fact that it did not last even a day was disappointing. My daughter is little so she still likes it and pretends it's dancing but it would have been nice if it had lasted longer.

title: Great value for a lot of dice
text:
This is a really nice value for someone who may be a dice hoarder. The colors are beautiful and quite sparkly. The orange/yellow ones looks somewhat like amber which is a nice effect. I like to have different dice that fit different characters and this set goes a long way!

They feel pretty well balanced and, while I haven't played with all of them yet, the ones I have rolled felt good and were well weighted. They feel like most of the other plastic/resin dice I have.

Some of the numbers are in gold and others in silver. I wish some were different but they still look nice. I did notice that a few have varying amounts of paint in the numbers. See the photo of the 6 sided die from different sets. Some are over and under filled but others are right where I would expect them to be.

This big set comes with a nice quality dice bag. This set fills it up about halfway. The bag feels nice and durable. It is also very soft.

Overall, I am very happy with this set and it is a great addition to my collection. It would make a good gift for someone just starting to collect dice.

title: Interesting design
text:
Overall I think these are pretty cool dice, I like the color and the octopus design feels like it would fit in very well in some kind of a Cthulhu or other Lovecraftian D&D story. I like the overall quality of them they are a hollow die set so they aren't too heavy even though they're metal. I will say that the the gems that are in the eyes aren't super apparent even when you hold it up to light. If I hadn't read that they were there I wouldn't of thought they existed to be honest. This is a pack of just six sided die there are no other shapes in this set so it has somewhat limited use for a character unless you were using it as a DM or a specific character need. Might be cool for other games though.

These are decently balanced and feel nice in the hand. They aren't too heavy and are easy to roll, after rolling several rounds they were consistently inconsistent and numbers so I'm happy and confident that they aren't weighted oddly.

title: Beautiful well made dice
text:
This is a beautiful dice set. The edges are quite sharp but it is well made and the inside has a lovely opalescent quality. It arrived in a nice metal tin instead of a baggie. These roll nicely, though I have only used them for a one shot to test them so far. I did not notice any weight distribution issues.

These are excellent for lawful good, fey, paladin, celestial, cleric, etc type characters as they have an almost ethereal vibe to them. Very beautiful!

title: Decent set with a lot of pieces
text:
Overall this is a decent pet play set. My 2.5 year old has been obsessed with doll houses and figures so this seemed like a good choice for her as she loves animals. It is marked 3+, so we took out the very small accessories for now.

There are two pieces that need to be assembled: the swing and the slide. There are no directions but they are a snap to get together. The slide has three parts: the blue slide and the right and left halves of the ladder. I recommend putting the prongs from the blue slide into one side of the ladder and then clicking the other half of the ladder in place, lining up the steps as you go.

The swing has six parts: the seat, the “rope” on each side, the top (where the hooks are), and both sides of the stand. Because the other pieces were prong and hold style I kept looking for something like that but the top pink piece with the hooks clicks right into the bluish side pieces. The “ropes click into the seat and then slide into the hooks.

The quality on this set is decent. There are a lot of accessories with different functions so you can tailor the play accordingly and use the same basic set for different stories. There are basic “house” style furniture, pet bed, dog house, food bowl, etc. then there are also veterinarian tools like a syringe, stethoscope, and random pink box with a cross on it. There are also pet grooming accessories like brushes, scissors, blow dryer, shampoos, sprays, etc. then there are pet shop style display boxes and a pet carrier.

There is a nice mix of cats and dogs with basic plastic colors (white, gray, off white/tan). The paint job on the faces leaves something to be desired. The eyes are either crooked or missing completely. I plan to take my mini paint brushes and touch them up a bit before giving this to my daughter.

The plastic feels a little thin compared to other similar name brand sets and the stickers are askew on a few pieces. It also came with a lot of cardboard inserts to use in the display (all the same image) which I am never a fan of in kids toys. If you leave it, it will get wrecked. It also is a wasteful use of cardboard. The set is not improved by their presence and we just throw it in the recycling.

title: Cute idea but not great quality
text:
This is a decent accessory set for a police costume or as I'm using it for play therapy, though the quality on these is lacking. They don't feel particularly sturdy and they don't feel like they will hold up, where these are used regularly and play therapy I'm worried they won't hold up very long. For the price if you were going to use these for a costume like for Halloween or a single or limited events I think that these would be a great fit but for continued long-term use I can't really recommend them.

They look cute and the colors are nice but the difficulty with the quality just makes it less than what I was hoping for.

title: Nice set of cards to learn and grow with
text: This is a nice flash card set, it is easy to use and feels pretty durable. Some of the words are a little bit more difficult but I think that's good for exposure to bigger words for younger ages. My two-year-old is a fan of using these and I'm sure will get plenty more use out of them in the years to come. We don't handle these gently and they've held up great so far. Like most other Melissa and Doug products we have we are pretty very happy with these for our kiddo.

title: Excellent value for an adorable dollhouse
text:
My daughter loves this dollhouse! It is an excellent size and looks just as pictured in the listing. It arrived in a large flat box and needed to be assembled. It took two of us to assemble it as you have to have an extra set of hands to hold it still while you screw it together. With my daughter “helping” as a two year old does, it took us about 30 minutes to open, assemble, and set up.

It comes with two little people and a bedroom set, a living room set, a kitchen set, and a bathroom set. They quality is nice and compares well to the Melissa and Doug dolls that we also have. As a play therapist, I use several doll houses and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and number of extras that came with this for the price.

title: High quality and beautiful
text:
This is a beautiful dice set. They are well made and nicely balanced. We've used these for two sessions and they were a lovely fit for an elven magic user theme-wise. The metal is heavy and substantial feeling while being easy to use. The edges aren't too sharp and there are no spurs or manufacturing defects.

Highly recommend a set from this company!

title: Excellent crayon set for toddlers or strengthening hands
text:
These are an excellent set for toddlers and older kids who need extra help with their fine motor control and developing skills. They are the perfect size for small palms and they are easy to use. These are great for occupational therapists or teachers or just at home!

They are very easy to wipe clean and are quite durable. My toddler often snaps crayons as she learns how hard to press and hold them. These hold up perfectly. There is a wide variety of colors.

The box was smashed on arrival so we store them in an egg crate but the “eggs” themselves had no damage from shipping.

title: Beautiful treasure chest
text: This is a very nicely made treasure box. I am a big fan of little props and set dressing for campaigns and this is a fantastic addition to our props. The materials are nice and it feels significant, not just like a dollar store prop (like some of the others we have). It is durable and filled to the brim with loot and treasure. Very happy with this set!

title: Fun but skip some
text: These are a fun idea. We received the questions and challenges set and it has a good mix of silly/sexy ideas for challenges and games. Some of them range from things like “first person to remove an article of clothing from the other without their hands” are fun but there are also some silly ones like drawing a unibrow or pushing a vegetable across the ground with only your nose. We had a “skip” house rule if we really didn't think one would be fun and it was overall really enjoyable! Nice for a date night stuck at home!

title: Heavy but fitting for some characters
text:
Used these for the first time last night for my husband's half orc paladin and they were a nice fit for the character. They are very rustic looking and have a nice style to them. They are easy to read after a roll, though they are quite heavy. It took him a little getting used to as he usually uses the lighter weight plastic/resin dice.

The quality is quite nice with these, they are substantial feeling and have no sharp edges or manufacturing defects. Very nice set that comes with a bag!

title: Excellent safe play rubber knife
text:
This is an excellent soft rubber knife! I have been looking for a very bendable rubber knife for use in a play therapy setting. This is nice and thin and does not hurt to be hit with. It is not sharp or dangerous. Ideal for a situation where a kid might get too excited or into the narrative. It would be very difficult to hurt someone with this. The handle is hard plastic but the “blade” is not.

It is lightweight and feels durable and sturdy. Excellent for a costume or for aggressive play or cops and robbers type games.

title: Beautiful DnD dice
text:
These are perfect! They are smoky and a beautiful twist on your standard dice set. I got the smoky black one because it was a good fit for a new character and with the gold engraved numbers, I was in love! Easy to read and beautiful with light shining through them. They feel excellent to use and are nicely weighted. Very very pleased!

These would make an excellent gift for a dnd friend and I bought two more sets for my husband's characters. The price is excellent for the quality!

title: Nice set for young kids
text: My toddler loves this set. It feels sturdy and durable. She is not gentle with it but the plastic is thick enough to feel like it will last. It is a snap to clean and easy to do a lot of things with. We use it at the beach and in the sand tray in my office.

title: Love this busy board
text:
My husband and I both work in developmental pediatrics and I am a play therapist. We both adore this busy board and our own toddler loves it! It is very nicely made and feels durable. High quality busy boards can be very pricy but this one is a good deal for the price and sturdiness.

It is small enough to take in the car or on a plane but it still has enough room to fit all of the fine motor activities you would expect from a busy board. Zipper, clip, laces, and a latching door are our daughter's favorite.

The edges are nice and smooth with no rough or sharp bits. The color scheme is nice and neutral and is nice looking.

title: Eiffel Tower themed dice
text:
These are and interesting dice set… they look very cool from afar but up close they look less intricate and once you realize they are covered in Eiffel towers, you get some questions.

The weight for these is odd and I don't know if is just because I am used to resin dice but they aren't as comfortable to use.

Neat enough idea I suppose but I just don't know who would need these?

title: Beautiful high quality set
text:
My daughter adores this set! It is nicely made and feels high quality. The wood is smooth and nicely painted. It feels sturdy and durable and has held up to my daughter running it off more than one table. You can fold it down to make a ramp to load up the top cars then stand it up for the bottom row. This even fits some of her other toy cars that didn't come with this.

We painted on the cars that came with it to make them “racecars” and she loves them! Very pleased!

title: Beautiful gaming dice
text: These are a beautiful addition to games with a fantasy feel. The colors are gorgeous and they come in a nice black bag to store them in. They are easy to read and feel nice in hand. There are no sharp or pokey bits on them and they feel nicely made. We plan to use these for a campaign this weekend and we are very excited!

title: Okay but not great
text: I really loved the idea of these but in practice they just don't work well for us. They are tough to assemble and don't always stay connected. The colors are a little bit much as well. Overall, not my favorite and not our go to for hula hoops.

title: Great pack of chalk
text: These are perfect summer sidewalk chalk! There are a lot of different color and style options. They have held up well to my toddler smashing them into the concrete everytime we go outside. She has no problem holding them and finds them easy to use.

title: Very giftable
text:
This is a great set of wooden instruments! It feels sturdy and durable. My toddler loves instruments and music so we wanted a set that would hold up and be easy for her to use. These are perfect! They feel nice and well made. They are smooth and we have not found any sharp or pokey bits.

You get a lot in this set and it would make a great gift for most kids!

title: Decent skeleton medical prop
text:
I got this for two reasons: one to help with an anatomy and physiology class and two because for some reason, my toddler LOVES skeletons (or suhketens as she calls them). This is a decently constructed anatomical model, though I have a few things that I didn't love about it.

1.) construction. Part of it is assembled but the skull cap, legs, and stand aren't. The skull cap does not sit or attach correctly and leaves a decent gap on one side if you push it down on the other side. The tabs don't fit well into the holes.

2.) the joints. The joints on this aren't ball joints where they should be. It's not THAT big of a deal but it would have been nice to have had ball joints for appropriate range of motion.

3.) quality/manufacturing. There are sharp pokey bits all around this thing where they were not sanded or trimmed right in the manufacturing process. Easy to fix (just sand it down) but a hassle. The plastic is a little thin so I don't know how long this will hold up.

I do like the spring jaw mechanic, it wasn't expected so it is a nice piece. It also comes with a nice poster labeling the bones and anatomy of the skeletal system.

This would be a great prop for medical use or in a classroom.

title: Easy to use a lot of fun!
text:
My toddler loves this app and system! It is easy to set up and has lot of modes that are fun and easy to get familiar with letters. It offers hours of entertainment and educational opportunities. We love to sit together and go through the different modes.

The one where the monster eats letters and makes a banner is our favorite as the monster spits out the wrong ones (my daughter finds this hysterical).

Very pleased and plan to get more on this set!

title: Great variety and extras
text:
These are easy to use and hold, even for smaller hands. My toddler is just getting really into coloring and her favorite motion is a “dotting” motion. These fit her needs perfectly. They were all nice and had plenty of ink/pigment in them. There weren't any that were dried out.

The pens are pretty big and thick so she has to use a full fist Palmer grasp when using these which is fine for her age (21 months). There is a nice variety of colors and this set comes with a lot of extras which we really appreciate. The stencils will come in handy as she gets older but for now she is all about making big dots. This is a cute set and very giftable if you have a kiddo who is into big colors or who likes to make neat crafts.

title: Solid and sturdy feeling
text:
Thee are very easy to install and feel thick and sturdy. We used these indoors for Lycra swings and they are working perfectly!

Do make sure you attach these as directed and directly into a solid stud!

title: Pretty design, a little flimsy
text:
These are very pretty and fit our 18" Our Generation and Journey Girls dolls like a glove. You do have to be careful with them as some of the flipper pieces can start to rip if you tug at them. I have to help get them on and take them off to make sure they stay intact, we had one tear a little.

The designs are cute and there is a great variety in this set.

title: Nice, not scented
text:
These are a decent marker set. Overall, they are exactly what I expected.

They aren't as vibrant as our Crayola set but they do the job. I initially thought they might be scented as they have fruit printed all over them but they are not. The print is cute otherwise.

The tip shape and size is great for a variety of projects. None of them were dried out and they worked right out of the packaging. There is a good variety/range of colors. These would make a nice gift for someone who likes to color or if you don't want to spend too much on markers for someone who might smash them (my 20 month old is a prime example).

title: Perfect for BIG Thomas fans
text:
My husband and I just started introducing Thomas the Train to our little one as we had both loved him as kids. She loves this train! The paint job is beautiful and it feels durable and sturdy. I recommend getting the Trackmaster rail set (these are the right size) if you want it to run on tracks and these work perfectly. This would make a great Christmas gift or a birthday gift for those new or old to trains.

We love the storybook addition to it, it makes it a more immersive experience for our kiddo as we can read it and then she can play with Thomas. We have a lot of kids we work with at our therapy office who love Thomas so we may buy the full set to have at work!

Excellent quality, value, and craftsmanship.

title: Great value
text:
This is such as great value! There are a TON of puzzles in this set and it is great for a stocking stuffer or for keeping in the car for long car rides. They also make great fidgets for busy fingers.

I am keeping half of these at home and the other half is coming with me to the office for kids with fine motor and sensory processing needs.

The puzzles are pretty easy to solve but they feel well made. They feel durable and are decently thick. I haven't had any sharp parts or pokey bits on these. Very pleased!

title: Adorable and nostalgic
text:
These are so fun! I loved these as a kid and my kiddo is just old enough to enjoy scratching/coloring these. The stencils that come with these are so fun and we love the postcard idea. They have a nice bright rainbow underneath the black. Do make sure you use the tools, if you use your nails it can be tough to get the stuff out from under little nails!

Will be ordering more of these for my art room at the office.

title: Great idea, May need to add magnets
text:
I got these for my family therapy kit as I love the idea of having the kids in my sessions make their family and having a lot of options to do so. These feel like nice quality but I am worried about how long they will last before they get worn out.

I am planning to stick these on some magnet sheets and having the kids use them this way, it will make them last longer so the sticky stuff doesn't go away and they can be moved and used frequently.

Overall, very pleased with this kit. You get a lot of stickers for $10 and it is just the ticket for doing a genogram or acting out family scenarios.

title: Great fine motor skill builder
text:
This is a very cute idea. We got this for use in the occupational therapy department of our clinic and it is wonderful for fine motor strengthening and coordination. A great fit for kids who love dinosaurs!

It is easy to use and can be a little challenging to “dig” out but this works great for us.

This is a great gift idea or for a learning unit in a classroom. It comes with info on the dinosaurs which is a nice bonus.

title: Cute monster camera
text:
Cute little camera to get kids started. Is this the kind of camera you'll be using to take high quality photos? No. But it is a great inexpensive introduction to photography in a cute package.

It comes with a memory card and a little strap. The monster face on the front is adorable. I wish it came in other colors as my daughter loves green but the pink is cute.

It has a lot of little extras in it that are fun to try out.

It feels sturdy enough to survive a few drops or getting thrown in a backpack. Overall really nice idea.

title: Nice but not great
text:
This is a neat idea but it isn't quite accurate as a “sudoku” cube. The 5's on it are fixed in place in the middle so you will never be able to fully solve it correctly as you would a normal sudoku across the whole thing.

It feels a little wiggly so I'm worried about it holding up over time but it does turn pretty smoothly. Would make a nice gift or stocking stuffer for a kid who like puzzles.

title: Great scissors
text:
These are so so smooth! I got these to cut vinyl sheets for my cricut maker and these are fantastic!
The color is cute and fits in with the other things in my art room and they are very comfortable to hold.

These are a good value as I've seen these in some other big brand stores for quite a bit more than here. I have to hide these now as my “grown up” scissors so no ones uses them for kids projects or to open boxes!

title: Beautiful craft kit
text:
This is an incredibly cute gift idea! It arrived in a nice metal tray style box and in great condition. It comes with a variety of materials for making bracelets or you can even use some for other projects.

It is a great addition to our bead collection and fantastic for building fine motor skills. The box is so nice that this would be a great item to give for a birthday or Christmas.

title: Versatile educational activity set
text:
This is a cute little counting and sorting set! It has a lot of applications and is a good value for the price as the pieces feel nice.

The “stones” are satisfying to handle and touch as they have a velvety texture. This set is supposed to be for older kiddos but my 20 month old is obsessed. She loves to count the bears and stones (can do up to 11 now), name the colors, sort them into the matching color cups, and pinch things with the jumbo tweezers.

It is a little fussy to get everything in the case that comes with this but it will close if you move things around a little bit.

This is a great set for fine motor skills as well as early education activities.

title: Makes a lot of bubbles but doesn't push them very far
text:
This is a POWERFUL bubble machine! Even at the lowest setting it shoots bubbles out of there and fills the area. At even higher settings the bubbles come out so quickly they run into each other and create huge bubble clumps.

One thing that I wish was different was the blower strength. At the lowest setting it doesn't really push the bubbles out enough. As a result you end up with a pile of bubbles underneath the machine.

title: Versatile shavings
text:
These are great shavings for a variety of activities! I got these initially to use for sensory bottles where the filings would be attracted to a magnet wand and you can watch them move through the bottle.
After reading other reviews to get more ideas I also decided to make magnetic slime! This stuff is seriously so cool!

We use these for sensory activities but they would also be great in a school or at home to teach about magnets. It is pretty finely ground but I did expect it to be a litter finer. It definitely worked for what I needed but you can feel a “grit” to it between your fingers. Overall we are very pleased!

title: Well made truck!
text:
This is an adorable little dump truck! My 19 month old has been into cars and trucks lately so when I saw this I knew she would love it. It is nicely made with thick durable plastic. The texture feels soft and pleasant with no sharp edges or pokey bits.

There are a lot of nice details in this with the interior of the cab and the car parts under the bed of the truck. I love Battat's toys and this one is no different.

title: Fun and easy to use
text:
These are so much fun! My 19 month old loves them. She likes to stack them different ways and pretend to smell them and give them as “gifts.”

The pieces are solid feeling plastic with no edges or sharp pieces to poke little hands. These would make a great gift for little kids. You can rearrange the brown tracks as one big loop, a medium and small loop, or a long wavy track.

These are great for building fine motor skills and working on multi step directions.

title: Nice quality and great for kids with sensory needs
text:
These are fantastic! I have the cat one as well and these are such a wonderful addition to my therapy room. They have a very light scent and heat up quickly in the microwave.

They are a little weighted which is nice for kids with sensory processing concerns. It is nice to use as a fidget or comfort object. These are well made and feel nice to hold and snuggle with.

title: Nice accessories and price
text:
These are nice dolls clothes for doctor dress up. They fit our 18” dolls perfectly and use Velcro to close which is easy for little hands to use.

The stitching is just okay on them and they are a little see through/thin. They would make a great gift for a kid who wants to be a doctor or who wants to play pretend to work through fears of going to the doctor. It comes with little accessories which is nice and the masks are great for playing pretend to talk about everything going on right now in the world.

title: Fantastic size and quality set
text:
This is a fantastic train set! It has a variety of track pieces AND different people and accessories. The quality is great for the price and variety of pieces. I got this as an addition to the set with our imaginarium train table for my therapy office and it is a wonderful set that my clients love to use!

Several of the smaller accessories have been used in sand tray therapy as well.

This is such a great value for the price and with the Black Friday sale, it is even better for Christmas!

title: Fun game for multiple skills
text:
This game is great for working on speech and language skills as well as fine motor skills. I got this for use in our therapy office and it is a hit! The kids love playing with it and don't think about the work they are putting in for their skills, just how fun the game is. It is easy to use and learn and the pieces are well made.

It is easy to sanitize before and after sessions which is great for outpatient use or even in a classroom. It doesn't take up much room on the shelf and is a snap to use for several therapists.

title: Excellent game for kids and familieS
text:
I love this game! I got this for my play therapy room to work with neurodiverse children and their families to improve memory and concentration and it has quickly become a favorite. It is often requested by my clients and even my coworkers (speech therapist/feeding therapist and occupational therapist) borrow it frequently.

It is easy to set up and learn to play and it is adaptable to help kids with multi step directions and descriptions. The images and illustrations are cute and fun, very colorful. The pieces are nice quality and don't have any sharp or pokey pieces on them. I may have to get more for my coworkers for Christmas so they stop stealing mine!

I will be keeping an eye on this brand for other games!

title: Incredibly fun
text:
My toddler is pretty big into bubbles and a double bubble wand seemed too good to be true. And wow does she love it. Too much. It lives on top of our fridge where she can't see it unless we want to play with it. Otherwise she will chant “bubble” if spotted.

This thing works exactly as expected and comes with the solution needed to use it which I very much appreciate.

It is a ton of fun and a great summer time activity just be careful on floors that might get slippery, this thing produces a LOT of bubbles.

title: Great value for a play kitchen set
text:
We love these as an addition to the play kitchen in our therapy room!

The pieces are nicely made and the plastic and metal is thick so I anticipate these lasting awhile. There is a lot of nice attention to detail in these pieces, more than I expected for the price.

This is a good value for the price if you are looking for a starter cookwear set for a play kitchen.

Solid set and we are very pleased!

title: Great quality and price for a TON of stickers.
text: This is a great sticker set! I got this for our art room for kids to use in projects or as a motivator for behavior and there are so many cute options. These stick well and feel like a nice quality for the price and number you get. These are a great value and we will be ordering more once these get depleted.

title: Adorable and easy to use for speech therapy
text:
We absolutely love this game in our therapy practice! Our speech team uses this daily and it has become a staple for a lot of our clients.

The rules are super easy to pick up and it directly addresses expressive language goals, letter sounds, naming, and more.

The packaging in this set is awesome and it also comes with adorable stickers that are a big hit.

title: Cute but too difficult for some kids
text:
This is a really cute idea for a card game but for us it just fell kind of flat. It was difficult for some of our 6+ year old kids to understand and we have ended up just using it as a matching game to focus on speech sounds.

The pictures are funny and the kids really love them but the rules take several run throughs to grasp and for our therapy practice that just isn't a great use of time.

Straight out of the box you can use them to imagine different scenarios or work on combining things. The little story book is a cute addition too.

title: Excellent value
text:
I am really pleased with the value of this set! It comes with so many different pieces and miniatures and shaping tools. I got this to expand on my sand play therapy selection and I am thrilled with this set.

The plastic tub is a decent thickness and is holding up well to some rough play with my clients.

The dinosaur molds are a huge hit and we have used these with several other mediums as well.

The sand feels nice and is on par with other kits and sets. It is a little bit stiffer to use than my other sand but this might just be a preference thing.

title: Paint quality is just okay
text:
These are an okay set of dinosaurs. They are all herbivores with one being dead and partially eaten. This one does not make a general appearance in my play therapy room.

The paint quality is mediocre and a little sloppy in some places. The feel durable enough and the plastic is fairly thick (not a lot of bending happening).

If you are looking to beef up a Dino collection then these might be worth it for you.

title: So much fun!
text:
[[VIDEOID:dc60b9d1081e1a9c48fc1c004324ee29]] We love this piano! My kiddo is 19 months old and took to it immediately. It has so many different settings for volume, recording, songs stored in it, and different instruments. You can easily switch between piano and guitar or xylophone.

It is huge and yet stores easily, if we ever do store it. The instructions do say NOT to fold it too much or the wires inside could get damaged.

This would be a great gift for kids or any age (my husband certainly loves it!)

title: Cute and easy to use board, needs small screwdriver
text:
This is a nice little number puzzle. My 19 month old loves to use it and name all of the numbers.

It is colorful and the corners are rounded. It isn't very big but it works for little hands.

The battery pack on the back uses an incredibly small screw driver. It wasn't one we had on hand so we had to go an purchase one which was a little annoying.

Our board has some scuffs and marks on it and looks like it may be used? Or at least it's a manufacturing issue or something. The packaging was fine when it arrived but the board itself is damaged (see photos).

title: Versatile play foam set
text:
This is such a fun set for play foam!
We use this for speech therapy activities, by using the prompt cards and shaping the foam. We don't use it “as intended” as this is listed as a 4 or more person game. We have no issue doing a modified version for our clients with just two or three people!

The foam is easy to shape and a nice quality. This set comes with a timer and prompt cards as well as two foam colors. Very happy with this set and we recommend it for family game time!

title: Great quality
text:
I am very pleased with this set of language cards. It has a great variety and I love that a concept is shown in multiple ways. My husband does speech therapy and we both take turns using these at work.

The print quality is great and the cards feel thick and durable. I expect them to hold up well to frequent abuse over the years. I love the variety of cards and the images. Very helpful for therapists and families.

title: Adorable and very useful
text:
This is a nice little stuffed sensory kitty. It has a decent weight to it and it can be warmed for additional stimulus. It is very calming to use and I keep it on hand in my therapy room.

I don't get much of the scent from it. It is very subtle which is appreciated. I am not personally a huge fan of lavender but it is quite calming for the kids I work with.

This is cute, useful, and a great price. This little kitty would make a great gift to help calm littles to sleep.

title: Flimsy but cute
text:
This stroller set was pretty easy to set up. I did have to manhandle it a little to get it to click out. It feels a little flimsy but for the tiny doll that came with it, I'm not too worried about it.

I got this for our play therapy room and it fits right in with our other dolls to play “house”.

It is a little tough to get the doll to sit upright and the tubes that make up the frame aren't very thick so a heavier doll might slip down/out while in use.

title: Double check when assembling
text:
This is a versatile cube! We put it in our sensory gym and it works great with our other equipment. This was incredibly easy to put together and only took about 10 minutes. My only complaint is that one of the pre drilled holes for the rods was off. I did have to widen it and then glued it to make sure it will be secure.

Overall I am pleased with this cube!

title: Great variety for a good price
text:
This is such a fun addition to our sand tray and play dough area! There are a variety of shapes and tools and they are a decent quality of plastic. There aren't any sharp or pokey pieces. They are nice to handle and they are a nice thick plastic. We have used them with clay, kinetic sand, play dough and more!

This is a great gift for a teacher, kids who like to use clay or play dough, or an art room!

title: Great variety!
text:
This is an awesome set! I love the variety and the neon, glitter, and glow in the dark options! These are pretty sheer so you have to layer them. I used these with acrylic paints to do a forest scene and these were wonderful for getting some transparency in the leaves and giving the piece some depth.

I got these for the art room in my therapy office and they are a great set to round out our paint options. The kids especially love the glittery options. We use the glow in the dark paints in the sensory dark room and they glow pretty well (orange seems to glow the best).

title: Shimmery slime
text:
I am so used to making slime myself that it was honestly so nice to just have it ready to go on hand! In my opinion this smells better than others I've worked with and even better than the ones I make myself.

It does still have that classic glue smell but it isn't as strong as I expected.

The glitter in this is so fine that you cannot feel it. I've had other slimes in the past that feel chunky or even pokey due to big glitter pieces. This is smooth and satisfying.

I do find that this formula will “snap” if pulled too hard and can sort of “shatter” with little pieces getting all over if pulled too fast/hard. Watch out for your carpet/clothes if doing this.

Absolutely gorgeous slime colors, very pleased!

title: Dreamy cloud slime
text:
This stuff is so much fun! I work with kids with high sensory needs and having slime/putty options is a lifesaver. This stuff feels amazing and so different from the other slimes in my collection.

It was easy to use and really fun to set up. It took maybe 10 minutes altogether and clean up was a snap.

I highly recommend this if your kid likes slime but wants something different!

title: Versatile and huge set!
text:
These are so awesome! We got them for work with our occupational therapy clients and they are great for motor planning and fine motor work. These are comparable to the higher priced “name brand” ones we have.

As a plus, my 18 month old is obsessed and every time she comes into the office she makes a bee line for them. She likes to stack them up and stick them to the break room fridge.

These come with wheels and everything you need to make a ton of different configurations and designs.

A bit hit!

title: Bright and pigmented
text:
These are great for a value pack of crayons for a classroom or a party. They are nicely pigmented, though a little bit thick and chunky if you press down too hard. They feel somewhat... waxier than crayolas? If that makes sense. They draw smooth and glide nicely I think because of this.

The packing is plain brown cardboard with no branding on it which is nice if you want to put stickers on them for a party or let each kid decorate their own.

Very pleased with the quality and number for this set!

title: Cute little bead maze
text:
My 18 month old adores this! It is smaller than I expected but it is the perfect size for her. She loves to carry it around and count on it.

It is very nicely put together and there are no sharp parts or splinters. The paint quality is nice and very cute. It is light weight and well made.

She's happy so we're happy!

title: Excellent wooden vegetable cutting set
text:
[[VIDEOID:5badaec8641d5423c7c230d88e30b0f0]] This is a great wooden cutting set! As someone who runs a pediatric therapy clinic with occupational therapists and play therapists, we have quite a few of these type of toys as they are great for both pretend play and fine motor skills.

This set is incredibly durable and well made. The Velcro pieces are recessed into the wood which makes it difficult for kids to peel the Velcro off, something that happens with our plastic sets. The paint detailing is nice and has a cartoon vibe to it that fits in well in our play kitchen.

These are harder to cut than one of our other kits but the knife is far sturdier than the plastic ones so I'm not worried about that. These feel durable and very sturdy. The pieces are thick and smooth, with no sharp edges or points.

Very pleased with this set!

title: Adorable little baby
text:
My 18 month old has started getting more interested in dolls and this one is the perfect size for her to pretend with. She recognizes it as a baby and will hold it and hum (which is so cute to watch!). The little pineapple outfit it comes with is very cute and soft. The hat comes off to reveal the baby's hair which is molded plastic (nothing to get tangled). It is a nice quality and my daughter loves to put it in the play stroller and push it around. I love that this is washable.

I'm a play therapist and having nice quality baby dolls in different sizes in really helpful during therapy sessions so this will be coming to work with me, I'm sure.

title: Adorable toy in and out of the bath
text:
My daughter loves this! She is 18 months old and loves any kind of musical instrument. Getting to take this in the bath is such a treat and she gets so excited for it. She likes to carry it around and copy the sounds. The ray design is very cute and the material doesn't have any sharp or pokey bits. It seems quite well made and has held up well to daily wear/banging/dropping/throwing. It dries quickly post bath so I don't have any worries about mold or yuckies. We have several Munchkin products and always love their quality and designs, this is no different!

I am happy to recommend this for any kiddos who are exploring music and want to make bathtime more fun!

title: Nice value swing
text:
This is a really nice swing. It feels substantial and sturdy. The chains are thick and well coated with no sharp or poky parts. It was a breeze to install in our climbing frame and we got this for indoor purposes but it would de great outdoors as well. Very pleased with the weight limit as well

It is a good value for the price as some swings with attachments this nice can be even double to cost.

title: Colorful ladder
text: This is a great ladder for an indoor or outdoor play gym. The rope is thick and very sturdy feeling. It is pretty easy to install, though the included strap is not my favorite as it is a little thin. Instead we used a therapy Swing hook up and carabiner from Southpaw and it works great!

title: Excellent climbing swing
text: This is a great swing! It is incredibly sturdy and durable. The rope is thick and the plastic didn't have any sharp edges or pieces. We got this for indoor use on our therapy frame and it is a blast to swing and climb on. The kids adore using it to jump off into a crash pad. We used it with a rotational device so it can free spin and it works great!

title: Fun but inaccurate
text:
This is a decent price for a 4 Person laser tag set. They are not the most accurate and they do take a ton of batteries (6 per set - 3 for each gun and 3 for each chest plate). 24 in total are needed for the full set. Each set is a different color which is nice, though some favorite colors like blue might get fought over.

We got these to use for family get togethers now that the kids are a little older and can all play together. They do a decent job but you have to be within 12-14 feet to accurately hit anyone. This isn't a problem for us because it's just really casual and we just keep running closer to each other to play but if someone has issues with this it could cause hurt feelings/arguments.

These are great for the backyard at night and flash brightly when you get hit. Overall very pleased with the hours of fun we've had so far.

title: Decent card set for young kids
text:
Only 8 of these cards are opposites on the same card. There are other individual cards (dog and cat) that could be used but they aren't really opposites. In total there are 42 words printed on the cards. 8 cards with 2 opposites printed on them, 26 with single words printed on them.

The pictures are nicely photographed and they are easy to use for a variety of clients. We got these for speech therapy and while they are nice quality, some of the opposites might be too abstract for 1-4 year olds as advertised.

They are definitely useful, though not exactly what we were expecting for a set of “opposite cards”.

title: Nice little lcd board
text:
This is a very easy to use lcd rainbow tablet. It is not very bright out of the box and in person. It looks much brighter in the photos than in real life.

When needed, you do need a very tiny screwdriver to replace the battery.

This is a nice drawing tablet that is mess free and seems pretty durable. Overall we are pretty pleased with it for our daughter over crayons that end up melting on our car seats! Easy to travel with and great for practicing letter shapes without wasting tons of paper.

title: Not grammatically correct
text:
This is a nice set of conversation starters, overall. We got these to use in speech therapy and some of the topics are fun and helpful. There are others that fell flat and weren't as interesting. Worse, some were grammatically incorrect. “Who're you're favorite character and why?”

If you're working with students on speech, you really want these types of things to be correct. We took a star away for that.

Otherwise it is a nice set to grab and go with and it is easily stored. These would make nice icebreakers as well for new groups.

title: Doesn't stick well
text:
This is a really nice idea, but it doesn't stick great. The material is a little thin and there's no storage for it. The rooms are cute and the accessories and play. Again, you have to smooth your hand over the pieces for them to stick, which a kid might have a hard time doing.

We got this to use for speech therapy and it works well for directions, telling a story, etc. you just have to help the client put the pieces on. It does give you a decent selection of rooms and pieces, I just wish it stuck better and wasn't so thin.

title: Great value for a portable sand tray
text:
This is a great play sand set! As a play therapist, having sand tray options is a must and I am incredibly pleased with this set for the price. It comes with a ton of construction themed toys and two colors of sand (tan and blue). The sand tray is both collapsible and sturdy when being used.

This also comes with a storage bag that fits all of the toys easily when you are done cleaning everything. This saves so much room because it all does pack up nicely. This would be great for a playroom, classroom, or therapy space.

The sand doesn't have any weird smell that sometimes comes with kinetic sand. It feels nice and the quality is great especially considering the price!

title: Good value mini basketball hoop
text:
This is a nice little basketball hoop for a bedroom or office for the price.

Pros:
Easy to put together
Able to hang on wall or door
No tools needed for door hanging (comes with a 2 in 1 tool)
Low cost
Comes with needle tip hand pump
Includes two small balls
Clear backboard looks nice

Cons:
The balls are not the same size (1 is significantly smaller than the other)
Drill needed for wall installation (not really a con but good to know)
Paint job is a little sloppy

Overall a nice value for the money.

title: Adorable high quality corgi stickers
text:
These are really nice quality stickers. I had expected them to be smaller but they are nice thick stickers and are a really great size for decorating almost anything.

This is a good value because there are so many and the quality is high. Plus, the are unbelievably cute! I give stickers out to kids at work and these are already a favorite.

These come in a little bag and are individual/separate instead of being on a sheet, which is nice. I'll now be looking for other dog breeds like this because these are too cute!

title: Ideal for a baby shark fan
text:
Let me start by saying this is definitely a 5 star for my daughter and that is reflected as such here. My husband and I have a little less love for this because she loves it SO MUCH. In the car, running around the house, on walks, getting changed, etc. she will not leave this thing be.

Thank goodness it plays multiple songs. I was initially terrified it only played Baby Shark. The others are also favorites so it's a nice balance. It is easy to use, too easy really. The little book that comes with it is cute and fun to read together. My kiddo is 18 months and adores this.

title: Awesome play makeup set
text:
This is a really cute and nicely detailed play makeup set! I'm a play therapist and having role play and pretend toys that hold up to some abuse is a necessity. These are both cute and a nice value for the price. There are a lot of pieces to this set so I am so grateful for the absolutely adorable kitty bag to hold everything in!

I normally prefer wooden toys for durability but these are much easier to clean quickly which in our current times, is a must have. When I got these my husband was skeptical and thought they would “make a mess” because he thought it was actual makeup.

Very please with this comprehensive set!

title: Nice crawling tube for gross motor skills
text:
We always love B. Toys for our baby and also our pediatric therapy clinic. They don't use super bright colors which is easier for kids with sensory concerns to manage. Their stuff is nice quality and this tube is no different. My 18 month old is just tentatively trying to go through it, though she loves to roll it around the playroom. My 6ft 180lb husband was able to get through this to show her how to use it. It's a little shorter than the other one we have but this is great for smaller kids as the other one is too long for our daughter.

The two outer most rings of support are padded a little which is nice. It seems sturdy so far despite my kiddo trying to sit on it. The fabric is a little thin so it may rip easily over time, we'll have to wait and see.

title: Great value!
text: These are perfect for a classroom, art club, or party! There are a ton of them and they are nicely made. They cut smoothly and are comfortable to hold. We got these to use with a kids art group we run at our therapy clinic and these will be perfect to make sure everyone has them for cut out heavy activities and projects. The price on these is awesome for such a big set with high quality.

title: So much fun!
text:
I had never used a magnatab before but these are so cool! I am a play therapist and my husband and I run a clinic with speech and occupational therapy. These are fantastic for handwriting, speech and symbol and letter formation, fine motor work, and sensory integration. You can feel each ball connect with the stylus as you write or draw. This gives a very satisfying sensory feedback. The stylus is a nice shape and is comfortable to use.

Ours did have some balls stuck in the “out” position but it was easy to push them back in. My husband has enjoyed playing with this and my 18 month old likes to “erase” it. It reminds me of an etch a sketch from childhood in that you can draw and erase over and over again. Love this magnatab and plan on getting more for our clinic and clients to use!

title: Decent but soft busy board/adl board
text:
This is a nice little busy board that I could see working well on a car ride for a challenge or on a flat, level surface to make it easier. It does fold and feels a little flimsy compared to other busy boards with hard/stiff backings. This makes it a little more challenging to use the fasteners without a way to hold it down and keep it flat.

For some kids, this might be frustrating, so I would recommend it more for children who have established fine motor skills and are looking to strengthen them rather than emergent skills. This absolutely will be used by our pediatric occupational therapy team, though not any more than other adl options available.

It is a good choice for the price, though I am unsure if the quality will hold up.

title: Durable little hopper
text:
We got this in addition to the large size for our toddler. While she is too little to do it on her own, she manages it well and has a blast bouncing if we keep her stable. It is a very durable and well constructed bouncer/hopper.

The colors are pretty and aren't gender specific. It fits in well to a space them or even a unicorn theme. We use hoppers for our pediatric occupational therapy clients because they help with core strength, balance, vestibular sense, and proprioception. They are a great option (if you have the space) for children who have sensory seeking/deep pressure needs because they will hold up to the abuse.

This is a great value for the price as it is very well made and I expect it to last us a long time!

title: Durable large hopper
text:
This is a fantastic, large sized hopper! It accommodates our most energetic pediatric clients and my equally energetic 200lb husband.

The colors on it are nice and it feels durable. I was able to quickly pump this up with the included pump in moments and we were good to go! There was a slight rubbery smell when we took it out but it was mild and had completely vanished by the end of the first day.

Very pleased with this and our pediatric clients (and my husband) are too!

title: Nice value
text:
Play wheels are a great piece of equipment to have in a sensory gym and this absolutely fits the bill in our clinic. The stitching in the straps is high quality and it feels very durable. The carabiner that connects this to the hang frame in our gym uses a screw lock and seems quite sturdy. We opted to attach this to the swivel mechanism from Southpaw to enable kids to continuously spin without bunching up the strap as we keep extras of these on hand.

There are several spots of discoloration on the top and bottom of the wheel near the weld points. This isn't overly concerning but I will have my therapists keep an eye on it.

title: Hard bullets
text: Based on the other reviews, this thing breaks quickly, though we never got that far. I got this to use during play therapy as sometimes play weapons can be helpful in certain cases to have. The bullets are not soft at all. They have a hard rubber tip on them that hurts if you get shot. This seems like something a kid could seriously injure themselves or someone else with.

title: Adorable wooden play makeup set
text:
These are absolutely adorable and incredibly well made. My daughter is 18 months old and loves to spread them out on the bathroom floor while I do my makeup. They are highly interactive and hanger moving parts and the wood feels nice in hand. It is very smooth, and the paint is high pigment. This is a play set, so none of the makeup is real, this means no mess!

As a play therapist, this set is ideal for use in the therapy room for working on fine motor skills, role playing, social skills, turn taking, multi step directions and other goals. It is cute without being over the top or completely pink, is well made, and not plastic, which is much appreciated in play make up sets.

title: Versatile doll set
text:
This is a really cute little bendable wooden doll set. This is exactly the type of simple wooden set that we are recommended to use in grad school for play therapy. I love this set and my toddler loves them as well.

The only thing that drops it a star for me is the one with the green shirt. It is covered in something gross as if this set wasn't new. It has a brown stain across the shirt, so I won't be able to use it, which is unfortunate. I've tried cleaning it out but it hasn't been any use.

title: Fantastic sensory tile for the price!
text:
These are amazing for sensory processing skills and motivation for gross motor activities. My husband and I run a pediatric therapy clinic and have been wanting to get a set of these for some time for our clinic's hallway (river themed). We figured trying out one to get a feel for it would be a good idea.

These are incredibly well made! The bottom has a non skid, soft, foam. The top has a textured surface so kids aren't slipping on them.

We received the blue and I am absolutely sold on doing a “water walk” in our clinic with these fun tiles!

My 17 month old loves it as well and like it experiment with pushing/standing on different parts of it.

We are incredibly happy with this company's take on these awesome sensory tiles. These can get pretty pricy but being able to buy one at a time is more manageable for families but the value on these is fantastic. Many other big therapy supply companies charge out the nose for these and the quality is on par with the most expensive ones we have from said big company.

title: Great for pretend play!
text:
This is a very cute little gardening set. I hadn't read the description too closely so I was pleasantly surprised to see that the ends of the tools are coated metal. That being said they are very thin, if an older kid were to use these in the dirt with some force behind them, these might bend/warp.

I love the little case and the extras like the little hat. Very very cute! This is a great set to use for actual gardening/assistant gardening for kiddos who like to join in. I am a play therapist so I am using this for pretend play and with a sand tray. My clients love the rake for making “zen gardens” and getting all dressed up to plant fake flowers. Very cute set!

title: Nice little play coin and gem set
text:
Excellent play gem and coin set! There is a nice selection of colors in the gems and the backs of the coins have different images on them with sort of a pirate theme. There are more than I expected to get in this set which was a nice surprise. This is a great prop for a pirate/treasure themed party or for pretend play. These can used for counting and learning about money, role play, decoration/props, and fine motor activities in a sand tray.

The quality is decent, though some of the edges have pointy/pokey bits of plastic on them. Make sure you check them before you give them to a kiddo. We were able to smooth them down easy enough but I got poked pretty bad when I first grabbed one.

title: A fantastic play food set for fine motor skills
text:
Let me start off by saying I love this set. It is incredibly detailed and comprehensive. I love that the cabbage leaves can be taken off individually, same the with crab shell. This is a high quality set complete with pots and pans, a little cutting board, and a great assortment of Velcro foods.

I love Velcro foods with the “cutting board” because it is a great way to work on fine motor life skills (ADLs) and gives kids a chance to interact with play foods in a variety of ways. I am over the moon for this set both as a play therapist and owner of a pediatric therapy clinic but as a mom to a 16 month old who adores play food.

One thing I will mention here is that you should go through and take each piece apart to make sure the Velcro is thoroughly attached. On the crab, carrot, and cabbage the Velcro did not stick to the correct side. By placing it back over the side and pressing down, I was able to sort it out and it seems to be holding up fine now. Just wanted to put that out there in case anyone else had this issue.

title: A fantastic play set for dentist and doctor play
text:
I am a play therapist and having a great doctor and dentist kit is incredibly helpful when working through anxiety and fear around these visits. This kit is a two for one as it has everything I look for in both! Great value for the money and incredibly high quality.

There is so much thoughtfulness in this set. The blood pressure cuff is Velcro (just like a real one) and the part you pump up has a squeaky ball in it. There are interactive components to so much of this which elevates pretend play.

I love that it comes with a little bag to keep everything together. My only complaint is the flosser. I wish that it was a little thinner so it would fit between the play teeth to better demonstrate proper oral hygiene. It is currently too thick and won't move between the teeth.

title: Colorful blocks for fine motor skills
text:
This is an excellent little colorful block set. There is a good variety of colors and the blocks feel smooth and easy for tiny hands to grab.

This comes with a thin draw string bag to collect the pieces which is much appreciated. I do wish it was a little better made or maybe mesh to make it easier to clean the blocks. There is also a little paper with some block ideas on it. There was a weird smell to this when we opened it. It was almost like Elmers glue. My husband thinks it was the cardboard it came with and the smell faded after a day or two.

A very cute little set with a surprisingly large selection of blocks and uses.

title: Adorable and functional fine motor activity
text:
I adore this set of fruit lacers! We run a Pediatric therapy clinic and are always looking for fine motor and motor planning activities. This one is one of my favorites!

The little fruit are adorable but what really makes this for me is that the end (where you lace through the fruit) is a little caterpillar. This makes this not only a practical activity but one you can use for educational settings and with book activities (very hungry caterpillar anyone?).

We are incredibly happy with this lace up toy!

title: Soft, cute, and so much fun!
text: This soft, snuggly, musical bug is one of my 16 month olds favorites. She loves anything musical and this was no different. Since it arrived, she's carried it all around the house and loves to press the button on its stomach. Due to this, it has received a fair bit of wear. It has held up wonderfully. The middle button plays full songs and each of the legs plays a single note as indicated by the names.

title: Great toy and activity for kids who love fairy doors!
text:
This fairy light garden kit was the perfect addition to our magic themed occupational therapy space. We already have a fairy tree in place and this is an adorable piece in the space that our pediatric clients can interact with!

The changing lights are great for sensory integration and tending the garden can be used for a variety of therapeutic activities based around goals like multi step directions, turn taking, responsibility, and fine motor skills.

title: Cute, big, and fun for pool parties!
text:
This was a really great addition to our daughter's first pool trip! I was pleasantly surprised by the size and durability of the floaty. It fits my 23 lb 16 month old great and she seemed to enjoy being in it and the little toys that came with it.

It was a little tough to blow up by mouth and the shade/canopy falls down from time but we are so glad she enjoys it so much!

title: Quiet but easy to grasp and use
text:
After reviewing all of the positive reviews and reading about how easy it is for babies to hold, I bought this for our 2 month old at 6 weeks to begin working on her gross and fine motor strength and her cognitive skills.

She was having a difficult time gripping objects and this rattle absolutely held up to the hype about it being easy to hold! She didn't express a real interest in using it until 9 weeks old but she will bring it to her mouth and grasp it with both hands now (10 weeks)

Pros: happy with the price, the size, it is lightweight and easy to move around, nice looking design

Con: not a very loud rattle. You need to shake vigorously in order to get any sound. This may not be stimulating enough for some babies and the motion needed may prove startling to some.

My advice: practice showing your baby this rattle each day for a couple of minutes and help them by gently placing it in an open palm, once they have a little grip on it, move the rattle gently to show them they can create the noise. This may take a little while but keep at it! They will get there eventually! If your baby is more of a sensory seeker, this rattle might not cut it sound-wise.

title: DIY Ball Pit and Sensory Pool
text:
Why use a pool as Ball Pit?

In short: Ball Pits are a great therapy tool! The visual, auditory and tactile sensory stimuli and the proprioceptive feedback builds confidence and strengthens motor skills during occupational therapy. Using balls of multiple colors can help with visual sensory stimulus and they can be used to build early speech skills like color identification, counting and more. If properly padded and filled with crush-resistant balls, they can be great for deep pressure and vestibular activities (kids love to throw themselves into a sea of colors).

Using an inflatable pool means that you don't need this to be out all of time, it is soft and provides a decent cushion on the sides (we put a thick therapy pad under ours to protect kids who like to dive in). It is also easy to clean the pool and the balls all at once. Plus this can be used as a ball pit, put a duvet full of pillows and its a crash pad, fill it with water or sand, foam, goop, etc. There are loads of options to use this for.

Activities and games can also be created based on the child's age and goals. For example, one game we play a lot is a sort of tiny basketball. A therapist can ask the child to find a red ball and then a blue ball and shoot them into a hoop. Doing this works on color identification (as I mentioned before), receptive language, multi-step directions, and the fine motor skills of finding and grasping the ball, motor planning to throw the ball into the hoop, and so on.

To sum it up: They are fun, great for sensory and body awareness therapies, and I had this deep personal bias that it would just be so gosh darn fun to have one, even if just a temporary one to pull out as needed.

It cost us $37.99 and measures in at 90x 58 inches, which was a perfect size for the space beside one of our climbing towers/rope tree and the wall. If it ever gets a hole in it or gets damaged (which one has), I am not heartbroken, after all, it cost less than $40 and is easily replaced.

We blow ours up with the tiny electric air pump that we use on all of our inflatable therapy tools (peanuts and yoga and therapy balls). It is the same kind used for camping/air mattresses and works like a charm It is tough to blow up without this, so I definitely recommend picking one up if you don't have one!

There is a cap in the bottom that allows you to fill it up with water and then simply open the bottom valve piece to drain it later. We use this for balls, water, and sand play but you could fill it with foam or goop for another sensory-fun option.

I am still rating this as 5 stars though we have had to buy two. The first one we bought ripped along an inner seam (due to some of our rowdier kiddos) and was not fixable due to the location. Mind you, this was after month and months of constant daily abuse by multiple kids from age 3 to 12 all jumping off of, diving into, thrashing around, and generally having a good time with it.

title: DIY Ball Pit and Sensory Pool Must Have!
text:
I own and operate a small pediatric speech and occupational therapy clinic and work with a number of kiddos who have sensory processing needs. As a result, we have a wide variety of tools and equipment pieces on hand. Hands down, one of the best investments we've ever made are these ball pit balls.

Why a Ball Pit?

In short: Ball Pits are a great therapy tool! The visual, auditory and tactile sensory stimuli and the proprioceptive feedback builds confidence and strengthens motor skills during occupational therapy. Using balls of multiple colors can help with visual sensory stimulus and they can be used to build early speech skills like color identification, counting and more. If properly padded and filled with crush-resistant balls (like these), they can be great for deep pressure and vestibular activities (kids love to throw themselves into a sea of colors).

Activities and games can also be created based on the child's age and goals. For example, one game we play a lot is a sort of tiny basketball. A therapist can ask the child to find a red ball and then a blue ball and shoot them into a hoop. Doing this works on color identification (as I mentioned before), receptive language, multi-step directions, and the fine motor skills of finding and grasping the ball, motor planning to throw the ball into the hoop, and so on.

To sum it up: They are fun, great for sensory and body awareness therapies, and I had this deep personal bias that it would just be so gosh darn fun to have one (who doesn't love a ball pit!), even if just a temporary one to pull out as needed. We decided to try out and fill an inflatable pool so we could use it as a ball pit OR as a sand/water play sensory pool as we wanted.

We bought the 1,000 pack you see above and an additional 400 (same provider) to fill our 90" X 58" pit up just enough to where we felt it would be fun, though to be honest, I could absolutely buy another 400+ at some point just to really amp up the fun of diving into them.

I really like these ones because they are BPA and Phthalate free and they are crush proof, which has held up true so far for us and we've been using these for about 4 months daily with several kiddos who play rough.

These have been thrown, squeezed, stepped on, jumped on, dived into, you name it.

They clean easily with disinfectant wipes and spray and the pool makes it even easier to sanitize; simply fill up, wash, drain, rinse, repeat.

They may be a little bit smaller than some other brands but I personally prefer these and wouldn't buy any others around as the bigger ones can be too hard to children working on fine and gross motor skills to grip and throw.
